I assume that the center of the Moon is filled with treasure.
 
 Of course, this cannot be known for sure, but we must have faith in it. Otherwise, we won't get the treasure.
 
 After all, what can we lose by going to the Moon to dig for treasure? Rocket fuel? Precious resources and labor? Nah.
 
 Therefore, we should focus all of our resources on flying to the Moon, digging to the center, and getting all the treasure. Then we'll be RICH!
 
 If we don't do this, then the weight of the treasure will make the Moon crash into Earth and destroy all life.
 
 Anyone who questions this truth is an evil worshipper of the Moon-Crashing!
 
 (this is satire by the way)

I assume that the center of the Moon is filled with treasure.
 
 Of course, this cannot be known for sure, but we must have faith in it. Otherwise, we won't get the treasure.
 
 After all, what can we lose by going to the Moon to dig for treasure? Rocket fuel? Precious resources and labor? Nah.
 
 Therefore, we should focus all of our resources on flying to the Moon, digging to the center, and getting all the treasure. Then we'll be RICH!
 
 If we don't do this, then the weight of the treasure will make the Moon crash into Earth and destroy all life.
 
 Anyone who questions this truth is an evil worshipper of the Moon-Crashing!

 Very clever spin on faith. Faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen – I’m with ya’.
 
 What exactly has lead us to believe that there is gold in the moon’s core? Did we get a book that states this, or did we conclude this from some process?
 When we first began to have faith in this claim, did we try it, test it, make sure it’s not some scam? Can we, at times, get a “taste” of this treasure after we have gone through a moon-gaze? Or does the moon itself shed some sort of eerie light on those that stand in a certain place at its highest, fullness? What gives us this faith, and what is given for having this faith to keep us riveted to that goal?
 
 
(this is satire by the way)

 And a good one at that. I can hear the wheels a-spinnin’ :)

 Why do you assume? You must have a prophet before we make a profit.

What we should really be doing is killing all the cats we can find as they are a big cause of evil in the world - not only do we have records spanning centuries that they can cause bad luck, but they are associated with witchs! Cats held Egypt ransom demanding attention and benefits in return from being spared from their bad luck. 
 
 All we have to lose is a some effort and a bit of genetic diversity.
 
 The only reason you would disagree is that you've not really looked into the issue or are a complete Bastite wanting bad luck to happen to people - cancer is unlucky, you're going to wishing cancer on someone

And if you watched Cats and Dogs you would know that the cats ruled ancient Egypt and forced the Egyptions to build the pyramids for them. Cats and Dogs is our holy movie. I've watched it and it makes more sense now. Cats were the ones who forced us to live on an Earth with war and disease and such. Kill the cats!!!
